column4: So how would I go about having my /init/x.conf use one of those others? Sorry, I had to restart
I created a script in /init/ that's starting up before apparmor so it's starting unconfined
restarting isn't really an option as it breaks the process
Did you put a symlink somewhere else?
Wait,.... if you put the script in /etc/init/  that's the wrong place, isnt' it?
Ok
update-rc.d
It breaks what?
Why can't you start it in rc.local?
Well, it just says:  "add this line to your /etc/rc.local file: /usr/sbin/dnscrypt-proxy --daemonize"
So starting it last is what you want.
What does /etc/NetworkManager/NetworkManager.conf look like?
What broke?
I do not understand the step to "disable the local resolver"
I do not understand the step to "disable the local resolver" Because you never had dns=dnsmasq in NetworkManager.conf in the first place.
What did you have in there to start with?  (in rc.local)
No, I mean the line to start dnsscrypt
I thought you tried it?
Just use  /usr/sbin/dnscrypt-proxy --daemonize
pastebinit /usr/sbin/dynscrypt-proxy
I would just start over.  Follow the instructions just ast they are and see where it went wrong.
